alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 18 at 3:32AM MST until December 19 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...SNOW TODAY THROUGH THE WEEKEND FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST... .A winter storm will continue over the Inland Northwest Saturday and Sunday. Snow will become heavy over the Cascades Saturday morning through Saturday night. Travel will be difficult over Stevens Pass with this winter storm. Snow is expected to decrease by late Sunday morning over the Cascades and northern Washington and Idaho. Snow will pick up over the Washington and Idaho Palouse and the Washington Blues Saturday night through Sunday night. Heavy snow will persist in the Idaho Panhandle mountains into early next week. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches valleys with localized amounts up to 12 inches. Mountain accumulation of 12 to 20 inches. * WHERE...Eastport, Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Athol, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Priest River. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected Saturday and Saturday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
